questiontext.text:
Feedback applied to an amplifier

Feedback is applied to an amplifier such that \[\qquad A'=\dfrac{A}{1-\beta A}\] where \(A', A\) and \(\beta\) are complex quantities. \(A\) is the amplifier gain, \(A'\) is the gain with feedback and \(\beta\) is the proportion of the output which has been fed back.

  1. If at 30 Hz, \(A=-500\) and \(\beta=0.005e^{8\pi i /9}\), calculate \(A'\) in exponential form.
  2. At a particular frequency it is desired to have \(A'=300e^{5\pi i /9}\) where it is known that \(A=400e^{11\pi i /18}\). Find the value of \(\beta\) necessary to achieve this gain modification.

Mathematical statement of the problem

  1. Substitute \(A=-500\) and \(\beta=0.005e^{8\pi i /9}\) into \(A'=\dfrac{A}{1-\beta A}\) in order to find \(A'\).
  2. We need to solve for \(\beta\) when \(A'=300e^{5\pi i /9}\) and \(A=400e^{11\pi i /18}\).

Mathematical analysis

  1. We have \[A'=\dfrac{A}{1-\beta A}=\dfrac{-500}{1-0.005e^{8\pi i /9}\times (-500)}=\dfrac{-500}{1+2.5e^{8\pi i /9}}\] Expressing the bottom line of this expression in Cartesian form this becomes: \[\qquad A'=\dfrac{-500}{1+2.5\cos\left(\dfrac{8\pi}{9}\right)+2.5i\sin\left(\dfrac{8\pi}{9}\right)}\approx \dfrac{-500}{-1.349+0.855i}\] Expressing both the top and bottom lines in exponential form we get: \[\qquad A'\approx\dfrac{500e^{i\pi}}{1.597e^{i 2.576}}\approx 313e^{0.566i}\]
  2. We have \[A'=\dfrac{A}{1-\beta A}\rightarrow A'(1-\beta A)=A\rightarrow -\beta AA'=A-A'\] and \[\text{i.e.}\qquad \beta=\dfrac{A'-A}{AA'}\rightarrow\beta=\dfrac{1}{A}-\dfrac{1}{A'}\] So \[\beta=\dfrac{1}{A}-\dfrac{1}{A'}=\dfrac{1}{400e^{11\pi i /18}}-\dfrac{1}{300e^{5\pi i /9}}\approx 0.0025e^{-11\pi i/18}-0.00333e^{-5\pi i /9}\] Expressing both complex numbers in Cartesian form gives \[\beta = 0.0025\cos\left(-\dfrac{11\pi}{18}\right)+0.0025i\sin \left(-\dfrac{11\pi}{18}\right)\] \[\qquad-0.00333\cos \left(-\dfrac{5\pi}{9}\right)-0.00333i\sin \left(-\dfrac{5\pi}{9}\right)\] \[=-2.768\times 10^{-4}+9.3017\times 10^{-4}i=9.7048\times 10^{-4}e^{1.86i}\] So to 3 significant figures \(\beta=9.70\times 10^{-4}e^{1.86i}\)
